nodes.bodyText: This is correct; would "template to get" or "template to retrieve" be more accurate?
Good point! Changed to template to get. Thanks!
This somehow overloads the similar previous method, right?  Should we say something here about how/why, much as you have done for the async methods?

We have an async function for each type of version number, long and String.
As discussed offline, the function signature helps developers to differentiate between getTemplateAtVersion(long versionNumber) and getTemplateAtVersion(String versionNumber).

I guess the difference here is the length of the version number . . . but I'm a bit confused looking at these.  Can you check and make sure each similar/overloaded method has a descr. mentioning the distinction?
Would be easier for me to eyeball if we had a staged version.  Is that even feasible before a PR like this is merged?
As discussed offline, the function signature helps developers to differentiate between getTemplateAtVersion(long versionNumber) and getTemplateAtVersion(String versionNumber).

Would it be accurate to say something like "ignoring" or "disregarding any existing ETag conflicts."  ?
Or maybe "without evaluating the ETag values."  ?
Feels a little odd just attached with "and" this way.
Thanks! Updated to without evaluating the ETag values.
Is this the long version number variant?

long version number represents the Number format of the versionNumber as opposed to the String format.
Ex: long format -> 9 vs String format -> "9"

Do you mean that this method fires off the deletion?  Otherwise, this might seem like extra/unnecessary information.
Here and below (whose desc may also need clarification on the nature of the override).
This method lists the available versions. You are right! This paragraph is confusing. Removed it.
Nit, but I'd say "an empty string"
This means console or backend, correct?  Might be worth noting.
I think it could be the Console, Admin Node, Admin Java, and the CLI. This could change in the future as we add more SDKs. Should we mention all that here?
I think you're right -- let's not go down that path.
I'm not 100% clear here.  Are the number and the source the same thing?  Or does this actually get the version from which this version was rolled back?

The rollback source is a property of the version (metadata) of a rolled back template. It only presents in the Version if the template was a result of a rolled back operation. rollback source is actually the version number of the original template that was used for the rollback.
